entries.title: ECB Cuts Interest Rates for First Time Since 2019
entries.description: The quarter-point rate cut is a significant moment for investors and marks an inflection point in recent monetary policy.

entries.title: NIO Loss Widens on Lower EV Sales but Expects Stronger Second Quarter
entries.description: The Chinese EV maker ’s net loss widened in the first quarter, with electric-vehicle sales off to a seasonally slow start.

entries.title: Chanel Creative Director to Leave in Latest Fashion Shake Up
entries.description: Virginie Viard is set to leave the luxury brand, marking the departure of one of the few women to lead the artistic direction of a major fashion house.

entries.title: These Parents Are Shelling Out to Have Someone Else Pack Their Kids for Camp
entries.description: At elite sleep-away camps, some costing upward of $15,000, the pressure is on for parents to send junior off with all the right gear

entries.title: He Perished on Everest. His Last Letter Recounts the Harrowing Journey.
entries.description: A decade of correspondence offers an intimate glimpse into the life of mountaineer George Mallory.

entries.title: Want to Pay Cash? That'll Cost You Extra
entries.description: From ballpark hot dogs to parking tickets, more cash payments are coming with a fee.

entries.title: Israel Strikes U.N. School-Turned-Shelter in Gaza, Says Hamas Was Operating There
entries.description: Palestinian officials said dozens of displaced people were killed at the facility in central Gaza.

entries.title: Euro Would Fall if ECB Signals July Rate Cut Is Possible
entries.description: The euro would likely turn lower against the dollar if a widely-anticipated rate cut by the ECB were accompanied by signals that a follow-up rate cut in July was possible, MUFG said.

entries.title: Basic Materials Roundup: Market Talk
entries.description: The latest Market Talks covering Basic Materials.

entries.title: Energy & Utilities Roundup: Market Talk
entries.description: Centrica, Fortum and more in the latest Market Talks covering Energy and Utilities.

entries.title: Auto & Transport Roundup: Market Talk
entries.description: Stellantis, Renault and more in the latest Market Talks covering the Auto and Transport sector.

entries.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
entries.description: Cogeco Communications, ASML Holding and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

entries.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
entries.description: Ninety One, CIMB and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

entries.title: Will Cloud Software Be Ready for Its AI Moment?
entries.description: It is too early to determine winners of the artificial intelligence boom, but so far those companies haven’t been cloud software vendors like Salesforce and Workday.

entries.title: As Hospitals Grow, So Does Your Bill
entries.description: Consolidation across the hospital industry has contributed to the higher cost of healthcare.

entries.title: Robinhood Doubles Down on Crypto With Deal for Bitstamp
entries.description: The move comes a month after an SEC notice of a potential lawsuit over Robinhood’s crypto offerings.

entries.title: Oil Demand Is Still Resilient, OPEC Secretary-General Says
entries.description: Oil demand remains resilient, OPEC’s Secretary-General said at the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum, adding the cartel looks at economic growth, supply and demand to drive its decisions.

entries.title: Stock Futures Little Changed
entries.description: S&P 500 futures wavered while global markets broadly gains ahead of ECB rate decision and U.S. jobless claims data.

entries.title: Why Lululemon's Stock Is Going Out of Fashion
entries.description: As it expands beyond yoga, the company’s growth is slowing in its key market and it faces tough competition.

entries.title: Biotech Venture Financing Market Remains Tight
entries.description: Biotechnology entrepreneurs early this year hoped for venture investment in their industry to recover. They’re still waiting.
